titleStmt.title: The declaration and resolution of Col. Iohn Poyer, governour of Pembroke Castle, concerning the Kings Majesty, and both Houses of Parliament; and his propositions to the western party, touching his present proceedings. Together with a full and perfect relation of the last great fight, betwixt the forces of the said Col Poyer, and Col. Fleming. With the manner thereof, and the taking of Tinby Castle by a party of Maj. Gen. Laughorns men.
titleStmt.author: Poyer, John, d. 1649.

titleStmt.title: The declaration and resolution of Col. Iohn Poyer, governour of Pembroke Castle, concerning the Kings Majesty, and both Houses of Parliament; and his propositions to the western party, touching his present proceedings. Together with a full and perfect relation of the last great fight, betwixt the forces of the said Col Poyer, and Col. Fleming. With the manner thereof, and the taking of Tinby Castle by a party of Maj. Gen. Laughorns men.
titleStmt.author: Poyer, John, d. 1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for R.VV. and are to be sold neer Temple Barre,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
